questiontext.text:
A vehicle entered in a ‘soap box derby’ rolls down a hill as shown in the figure. Find the total distance \((d_1 + d_2)\) that the soap box travels.

\((d_1 + d_2 = )\) [[input:ans1]] \(\textrm{m}\) [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]] (Keep 1 decimal place)

generalfeedback.text:
From the smaller right-angled triangle we find \[d_1 = \dfrac{200}{\sin 28^{\circ}} = 426.0\, \textrm{m}\]

The base of this triangle then has length \( l = 426 \cos 28^{\circ} = 376.1\, \textrm{m}.\)

From the larger right-angled triangle the straight-line distance from START to FINISH is \( \dfrac{200}{\sin 15^{\circ}} = 772.7\, \textrm{m}.\)

Then, using Pythagoras’ theorem:

\[ (d_2 + l) = \sqrt{ 772.7^2 − 200^2} = 746.4\, \textrm{m} \Rightarrow d_2 = 370.3\, \textrm{m}\]

Hence, \( d_1+d_2 = 796.3\, \textrm{m}.\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
